clinical_study.brief_title: tDCS Applied to the OFC: Effects on Decision-Making and Impulse Control
clinical_study.official_title: Modulating Decision-Making and Impulse Control With Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) Over the Orbitofrontal Cortex (OFC): A Randomized and Sham-Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the investigators aim to assess whether transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS; a safe and non-invasive method for modulating the activity of specific brain regions) when applied over the orbitofrontal cortex (OFC) is able to modulate decision-making and impulse control in healthy participants.

detailed_description.textblock: In this single-blind, three-arm and sham-controlled study, we will assess whether transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS; a safe and non-invasive method for modulating the activity of specific brain regions) when applied over the orbitofrontal cortex (OFC) is able to modulate decision-making and impulse control in healthy volunteers. We hypothesize that tDCS applied to the OFC, in comparison to sham tDCS, will significantly enhance decision-making and impulse control. For this study we will enroll 45 healthy individuals aged 18-60 years. These individuals will be assessed with a battery of computerized tasks as well as clinician-administered and self-reported questionnaires on depression and anxiety. Assessments will be carried out before and after a single 30-minute tDCS session.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the net score of the Iowa Gambling Task
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the "average-adjusted number of pumps" in the Balloon Analog Risk Task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the number of risky choices in the Game of Dice Task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the number of commission errors in the Continuous Performance Task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the interference index in the Stroop Color-Word Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the stop-signal reaction time in the Stop-Signal Task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a 30-minute tDCS session

arm_group.description: Anode applied to the left OFC and cathode applied to the right OFC
Anode applied to the right OFC and cathode applied to the left OFC

intervention.description: Anode placed over the OFC or the DLPFC and cathode placed over the occipital region

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men or women aged 18 to 60 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence any psychiatric and/or neurological illness
- Psychoactive substance abuse/dependence in the past 6 months
- Current use of medication(s) that might influence cognition and/or affective status
- Presence of an uncontrolled medical disease (e.g., cardiovascular, renal)
- Pregnancy and/or lactation
- Specific contraindication for tDCS (e.g., metallic head implant).
